TopicTitle: Vote for the next body to be mapped

Articles.Content:
With Kerbin done, and Mun and Minmus soon to follow I'm asking for the community to vote for which celestial body they would like to see next. Let me know why you think it's an a good candidate.

Check out the map of Kerbin if you haven't already at www.kerbalmaps.com

Edit: Voting closed, all ksp planets and moons have been mapped

Also see the release thread for news, release notes, and discussion.

Edited May 30, 2013 by saik0
I moved for Eve, good to know potential high elevation landing locations.
I have to agree on Eve, as it would reduce the amount of Butthurt caused by trying to get a lander up and down.
How do you do the maps? is there a tutorial for how your doing this - maybe could share the load to get the other bodies done quicker?

Duna, has plenty of easter eggs that can be found, also it takes less time to map since its smaller than kerbin

Sonyeah, go for Duna

How do you do the maps? is there a tutorial for how your doing this - maybe could share the load to get the other bodies done quicker?

Making the map tiles isn't whats holding the project up. Not knowing what the hell I'm doing with javascript is.

As to how: Custom plugins. The sat color data is obtained using the CreateMaps function. They look like this. Then we get elevation data by calling GetSurfaceHeight in a loop that outputs the data in a text grid. Then we use GDAL translate it into GeoTiff. From there I use the gtiff to generate a hillshade relief and overlay that on top of the color map to get the nice "satellite" view. Then I sample some colors from the color map at different elevations and make a color ramp and exaggerate them enough to not be confusing. We use that color ramp to make the color relief. Last we use the elevation again to compute slope, then apply another purple to pink color ramp to the slope map. I use the same slope colors for all bodies since values will always be 0-90 degrees.

Duna, has plenty of easter eggs that can be found, also it takes less time to map since its smaller than kerbin

Sonyeah, go for Duna

Actually it will take the same amount of time, but will be higher resolution Good point about the easter eggs though.

Agh! I accidentaly hit Dres rather than Duna, oh well. Anyway I think a Duna map would be nice to help find good landing spots in those canyons.
I don't know what this is but it's beautiful. Keep it up with Duna.
I need a map for duna (i need to search for the perfect place for my duna base).
I would say Duna, but I would rather have the Mun or Minmus be mapped next.

I would say Duna, but I would rather have the Mun or Minmus be mapped next.

They've been mapped, I just need the help of a webdev to help the project along (mostly js, for now)
Dun dun dunaaaa
Duna has a lot of interesting canyons, go for that. And the Kerbin map looks BEAUTIFUL, I love how detailed it is!

Duna !

Cdr Zeta
Laythe! (or Duna )
Duna or Laythe!
According to its map, Minmus has an anomaly. I know EXACTLY what I'm going to do now...

Aaaand the Minmus map is wrong, as far as I can tell. There is no anomaly that I could see, just boulders.

Poor Jeb was dearly hoping he'd find something out here, especially after the rough touchdown in which one of the legs snapped clean off the lander...

Aaaand the Minmus map is wrong, as far as I can tell. There is no anomaly that I could see, just boulders.

Poor Jeb was dearly hoping he'd find something out here, especially after the rough touchdown in which one of the legs snapped clean off the lander...

The Minmus anomaly is actually high up in the air, or at least it was. Try flying up and seeing if you can see it silhouetted against the ground, or if you have terrain rendering set to low, try clipping the camera through the ground and see if you can see it there.
I think you should add more information about the anomoly's too, Such as, What it is, instead on only the coordinates.
You voted and you got it. I've added Duna and thrown in Ike for free! Eve and Gilly are next, followed by Laythe.

No love for the Joolian moons I see. Tylo might be nice to have a good map of. It can be tough to land and take off from, so it might help to know where the high, flat areas are. Bop and Pol could be interesting because of how absurdly uneven they are.

Great work though, these are really well done.

Now I'll have to go check out this mysterious, fourth anomaly you've shown on Duna.

Great work though, these are really well done.

Now I'll have to go check out this mysterious, fourth anomaly you've shown on Duna.

Please share your expedition with us, I get the locations straight from game data so I've not had a chance to visit it myself. The name of the object in the game is SPOILER Pyramid SPOILER.

Edit: Put a flight capable rover down and investigated the surrounding terrain and skies, found nothing. Until I can confirm something is there, I'm removing it from the map.

Figured I'd mention the maps of all KSP celestial bodies are ready. Thanks everybody for voting.
